headline: Noisy Restaurant? What’s the Problem?
abstract: Pete Wells says he and many others actually like the racket that so many readers revile.
lead_paragraph: Whatever else readers say in article comments, on social media or in their emails to me, two responses are far and away the most common when I write about restaurants. The first is a rejection of the whole idea of eating out, because after all one can eat much more cheaply at home. To that, there’s not much to say except “bon appétit.”
